column4: Hi guys.  Is it possible to copy my wireless driver from the live cd and bring it to my installed OS?  The driver used for my wifi card works great in live cd, but, once I install Ubuntu 7.1, it doesn't work at all.  It is not listed in network manager.  So, can I copy a driver from my cd to my OS?
Anybody know anything about my question?
Can you post your question again?
What kind of wireless adapter do you have?
Ok lemme search the forums and Google for a minute.
Really? You can reboot to Windows if you dual boot and download the files you need and get it to work.
Sorry I closed the link. Can you post it again?
I wonder if you can just modprobe something. IDK which chipset your wireless uses though.
Try sudo modprobe rt73 and see if that was it.
Reading is one way to learn how to use Linux. :)
Does it work if you do sudo modprobe rt73?
Ahh it probably didn't get installed. I wonder if there is a rt73 package?
Change Directory, or move the terminal to a different folder. EG: cd /home/paul/Desktop would take me from /home/paul to /home/paul/Desktop
